title: Welcome To My Blog
text: Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: Vinicius Bastazini
text:
Mastodon
  
  
    
     Research Gate
  
  
    
     Github
  
  
    
     Google Scholar
  

  
  
I am an ecologist, currently working at the Mediterranean Institute for Agriculture, Environment and Development at the University of Evora. I have a broad (and when I say broad, I mean broad!) interest in Ecology, Evolutionary Biology and Conservation Biology, but my main interest lies in understanding the interplay between ecological and evolutionary dynamics and its consequences to patterns of biological diversity and species interactions. I address these kinds of questions by combining aspects of phylogenetics, network and functional ecology, using species traits as a biological building block to understand eco-evolutionary dynamics and their consequences to ecological communities and ecosystems services.
“What physicists view as noise is music to the ecologist” (Daniel Symberloff. 1980)

title: Vinicius Augusto Galvão Bastazini
text:
Mastodon
  
  
    
     Github
  

  
  
I am a researcher at University of Evora, Portugal, and my main interest lies in understanding the interplay between ecological and evolutionary dynamics and its consequences to patterns of biological diversity and species interactions.


University of Lisbon| Lisbon, Portugal
PhD in Ecology | 2019
Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul| Porto Alegre, Brazil
PhD in Ecology | 2015
Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul| Porto Alegre, Brazil
Master’s in Ecology | 2011
Catholic University of Pelotas| Pelotas, Portugal
BSc in Ecology | 2009



Biogeography, Community Ecology, Conservation Biology, Complex Networks, Evolutionary Ecology, Functional Ecology.

title: Professional Experience
text:

2016: Research Fellow - Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul - Laboratory of Quantitative Ecology, Brazil
2013: Visiting Professor Biostatistcs - Catholic University of Pelotas (Specialization in Conservation), Brazil
